tasks.task: Drive a tractor pulling a cutting machine through a pile of hay to cut it down.
subtasks: Sit in the tractor seat and operate the steering wheel to navigate through the hay pile.
Engage the tractor's power take-off (PTO) to activate the cutting machine attached.
Monitor the cutting machine to ensure it is operating correctly and making contact with the hay.
Adjust the tractor's speed as needed to maintain an efficient cutting pattern.

tasks.task: Load hay bales onto a wagon.
subtasks: Walk to the堆放好的hay bales.
Lift each hay bale onto the waiting wagon using both hands.
Secure the hay bale on the wagon to prevent movement during transport.

tasks.task: Drive the wagon to a storage area.
subtasks: Sit on the wagon to balance while steering with the handles.
Navigate the wagon to the desired storage location, avoiding obstacles.
Stop the wagon at the storage area and unload the hay bales as needed.

tasks.task: Unload hay bales from the wagon into a barn.
subtasks: Walk alongside the moving wagon to the barn.
Maneuver the hay bales from the wagon onto the barn floor or shelves.
Stack the hay bales neatly, ensuring stability to prevent tipping.

tasks.task: Stack hay bales on a hayrack.
subtasks: Lift a hay bale onto the hayrack using both hands, ensuring proper placement.
Adjust the bale to fit securely on the rack, possibly using one hand to stabilize.
Repeat the process for additional bales, building a stable stack on the hayrack.
Use a rope or twine to tie the stacks together, ensuring tight bundling.
Check the stacks for loose parts that may need additional binding.
Reinforce stacks with hay twine if necessary, wrapping spirals around the base and middle.

tasks.task: (*) Pickup hay bales and move them to the loading area.
subtasks: Identify hay bales near the storage area or cutting machine.
Lift a hay bale using both hands, lifting from the base to avoid straining the back.
Carry the hay bale to the designated loading area.
